intro: Microlicia macedoi, commonly known as the Macedonian microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
